body: I ran the tests 100 times locally with no hangs

issue.title: ftp: Add FTP over TLS support

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

Fixes #3146 

Especially for FTPS, there needs to be the ability to ignore certificate names. This could be added as another option or by making the `FTP over TLS` option a list with the options `no TLS`, `TLS without checking certificate`, and `TLS`. I'm still thinking about this.

Passing build: <https://travis-ci.com/gary-kim/rclone/builds/112378022>

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Adds support for implicit FTP over TLS.

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->
#3146

body:
Adding `-v` to `go test` makes it less likely to happen but it still happens.

I observed in real time the hang after the "mkdir" test.

body:
I finally managed to reproduce this locally....

With

```patch
diff --git a/Makefile b/Makefile
index 3cefc2625..492730185 100644
--- a/Makefile
+++ b/Makefile
@@ -54,10 +54,10 @@ test:       rclone
 
 # Quick test
 quicktest:
-       RCLONE_CONFIG="/notfound" go test $(BUILDTAGS) $(GO_FILES)
+       RCLONE_CONFIG="/notfound" go test $(BUILDTAGS) -count=1 $(GO_FILES)
 
 racequicktest:
-       RCLONE_CONFIG="/notfound" go test $(BUILDTAGS) -cpu=2 -race $(GO_FILES)
+       RCLONE_CONFIG="/notfound" go test $(BUILDTAGS) -count=1 -cpu=2 -race $(GO_FILES)
 
 # Do source code quality checks
 check: rclone
```

And

    ( for i in `seq 1000`; do echo `date -Is`: Trial $i ; make quicktest ; done ) 2>&1 | tee quicktest.log

When it hangs the process graph looks like this

github.com/ncw/rclone/fstest/mockfs github.com/ncw/rclone/fstest/mockobject github.com/ncw/rclone/fstest/test_all github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/atexit github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/dircache github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/encoder github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/encoder/internal/gen github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/env github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/errors github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/file github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/israce github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/mmap github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/oauthutil github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/pacer github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/pool github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/readers github.com/ncw/rclone/lib/rest github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs/test_vfs github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs/vfsflags
```
 4668 pts/6    Dl+    0:31      |   |           \_ /tmp/go-build859269780/b612/mount.test -test.count=1
```

Note that process 4668 is stuck in `D` state so is in the kernel.

So `strace` does not work

```
 sudo strace -p 4668
strace: Process 4668 attached
^C^C^\
```

Get these in dmesg

```
[175931.578568] INFO: task mount.test:30493 blocked for more than 120 seconds.
[175931.578573]       Tainted: P           OE     5.0.0-15-generic #16-Ubuntu
[175931.578574] "echo 0 > /proc/sys/kernel/hung_task_timeout_secs" disables this message.
[175931.578577] mount.test      D    0 30493  29003 0x00000004
[175931.578580] Call Trace:
[175931.578588]  __schedule+0x2d0/0x840
[175931.578591]  schedule+0x2c/0x70
[175931.578596]  request_wait_answer+0x133/0x210
[175931.578600]  ? wait_woken+0x80/0x80
[175931.578603]  __fuse_request_send+0x69/0x90
[175931.578607]  fuse_request_send+0x29/0x30
[175931.578609]  fuse_simple_request+0xdd/0x1a0
[175931.578611]  fuse_file_poll+0x19c/0x200
[175931.578616]  ep_item_poll.isra.20+0x44/0xc0
[175931.578618]  ep_insert+0x119/0x470
[175931.578620]  ? ep_show_fdinfo+0xa0/0xa0
[175931.578623]  __x64_sys_epoll_ctl+0x529/0x5f0
[175931.578626]  do_syscall_64+0x5a/0x110
[175931.578629]  entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x44/0xa9
[175931.578631] RIP: 0033:0x460bb8
[175931.578638] Code: Bad RIP value.
[175931.578639] RSP: 002b:000000c0004aaca8 EFLAGS: 00000202 ORIG_RAX: 00000000000000e9
[175931.578641] RAX: ffffffffffffffda RBX: 000000c0004aacf8 RCX: 0000000000460bb8
[175931.578642] RDX: 0000000000000005 RSI: 0000000000000001 RDI: 0000000000000004
[175931.578644] RBP: 000000c0004aace0 R08: 000000000000000e R09: 00007fb1ec573020
[175931.578645] R10: 000000c0004aacd4 R11: 0000000000000202 R12: 000000000000000c
[175931.578646] R13: 0000000000000032 R14: 00000000015dada8 R15: 0000000000000000
```

Indicating that everything has finished, but `go test` is waiting for `mount.test` but it has already finished.

Stracing the go process isn't particularly helpful

```
$ sudo strace -p 28931
strace: Process 28931 attached
futex(0xe4f508, FUTEX_WAIT_PRIVATE, 0, NULL^Cstrace: Process 28931 detached
 <detached ...>
```

So kill with -QUIT to make it dump a traceback does not work.

Running the mount test over and over again never produces the hang.  So maybe it is the mount test and the cmount test running at the same time which is the problem?  Can't be since the above test didn't run cmount (no -tags parameter)

issue.title: Use rclone.conf from rclone executable directory if already existing

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

To run rclone in "portable" mode, as in "portable app", by putting rclone.exe together with rclone.conf in a folder on a memory stick. Rclone will pick up the local config file without having to always remember to specify the --config command line argument, and not having to resort to launcher script like described in [forum](https://forum.rclone.org/t/how-to-change-the-path-to-the-config-file-rclone-cong-permanently/10324/5).

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

The idea came from [this](https://forum.rclone.org/t/how-to-change-the-path-to-the-config-file-rclone-cong-permanently/10324/5) forum post, although it does not describe the solution itself. 

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
This seems to make crashes happen quicker

```
export GOMAXPROCS=1
```

gave

```
18309 pts/3    Sl+    0:00  |                           |           \_ /tmp/go-build418892426/b612/mount.test -test.count=1
```

Redirected stdout to a file and did SIGQUIT and got a traceback at last!

Two important running goroutines are

This is serving the mount

```
goroutine 12 [runnable]:

syscall.read(0xa, 0xc000468000, 0x21000, 0x21000, 0xc0003d34e7, 0x7, 0x0)
	/usr/local/go/src/syscall/zsyscall_linux_amd64.go:732 +0x5a
syscall.Read(...)
	/usr/local/go/src/syscall/syscall_unix.go:172
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse.(*Conn).ReadRequest(0xc00032f1a0, 0x140efd0, 0xc000104540, 0x1621760, 0xc0004221e0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go:552 +0xe8
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve(0xc000104540, 0x16079e0, 0xc0003b9340, 0x0, 0x0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:414 +0x3ad
github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/mount.mount.func1(0xc000104540, 0xc0003b9340, 0xc00032f1a0, 0xc00032f5c0)

created by github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/mount.mount

```

This is responding to a message

```
goroutine 28 [runnable]:
syscall.Syscall(0x1, 0xa, 0xc00032c780, 0xa0, 0xa0, 0xa0, 0x0)
	/usr/local/go/src/syscall/asm_linux_amd64.s:18 +0x5
syscall.write(0xa, 0xc00032c780, 0xa0, 0xa0, 0xc00006b9a0, 0x40abf6, 0xc00006b988)
	/usr/local/go/src/syscall/zsyscall_linux_amd64.go:1005 +0x5a
syscall.Write(...)
	/usr/local/go/src/syscall/syscall_unix.go:191
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse.(*Conn).writeToKernel(0xc00032f1a0, 0xc00032c780, 0xa0, 0xa0, 0x0, 0x0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go:1097 +0xe2
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse.(*Conn).respond(0xc00032f1a0, 0xc00032c780, 0xa0, 0xa0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go:1110 +0x59
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse.(*Header).respond(0xc0004221e0, 0xc00032c780, 0xa0, 0xa0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go:313 +0x61
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse.(*CreateRequest).Respond(0xc0004221e0, 0xc0003f5110)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fuse.go:1690 +0x272
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).handleRequest(0xc000104540, 0x162aca0, 0xc0002e57c0, 0x16079c0, 0xc0002c3800, 0xc0002e55c0, 0x1621760, 0xc0004221e0, 0xc00006bef8, 0x0, ...)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:1116 +0x118a
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).serve(0xc000104540, 0x1621760, 0xc0004221e0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:878 +0x40f
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve.func1(0xc000104540, 0x1621760, 0xc0004221e0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:425 +0x6e
created by github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:423 +0x399
```

This runs fine

```
cd ~/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/mount
export GOMAXPROCS=4
( for i in `seq 1000`; do echo `date -Is`: Trial $i ; go test -v -verbose -count=1 ; done ) 2>&1 | tee mount.log
```

And this locks up almost immediately

```
export GOMAXPROCS=1
( for i in `seq 1000`; do echo `date -Is`: Trial $i ; go test -v -verbose -count=1 ; done ) 2>&1 | tee mount.log
```

with

```
2019-06-12T16:46:56+00:00: Trial 1
=== RUN   TestMount
=== RUN   TestMount/CacheMode=off
=== RUN   TestMount/CacheMode=off/TestTouchAndDelete
```

Travis runs on 2 core VMs according to this: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/reference/overview/#what-infrastructure-is-my-environment-running-on

Re-running the test with `export GOMAXPROCS=2` also locked up immedately.

issue.title: mount: tests lock up with GOMAXPROCS=1 or 2

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
As reported in #3154 the test for `cmd/mount` locks up if `GOMAXPROCS=1` or `2`

This runs fine

```
cd ~/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/mount
export GOMAXPROCS=4
( for i in `seq 1000`; do echo `date -Is`: Trial $i ; go test -v -verbose -count=1 ; done ) 2>&1 | tee mount.log
```

And this locks up almost immediately

```
export GOMAXPROCS=1
( for i in `seq 1000`; do echo `date -Is`: Trial $i ; go test -v -verbose -count=1 ; done ) 2>&1 | tee mount.log
```

with

```
2019-06-12T16:46:56+00:00: Trial 1
=== RUN   TestMount
=== RUN   TestMount/CacheMode=off
=== RUN   TestMount/CacheMode=off/TestTouchAndDelete
```

Mount is stuck in the kernel at this point making nasty unkillable processes.

The build issue has been worked around by setting GOMAXPROCS but the underlying issue remains.

body:
This ran for 4 travis builds so 6*4 = 24 builds with no errors, so I'm declaring it fixed until further evidence surfaces :-)

The underlying issue has been moved to #3259

Unfortunately this appears not to have fixed the problem with the build :-(

It has made it better but not perfect.

issue.title: b2: Implement link sharing #2178

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files
